keyMoments.title: Farewell to Jinbe
keyMoments.description: Luffy says goodbye to Jinbe as the fish-man departs, entrusting Luffy to Rayleigh's care for two years of training.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the beginning of Luffy's commitment to the two-year separation and training period.
keyMoments.quote: I'll get stronger! Strong enough to protect everyone!

keyMoments.title: Arrival at Rusukaina
keyMoments.description: Luffy arrives at Rusukaina island with Rayleigh, learning about the island's extreme conditions and powerful beasts.
keyMoments.significance: Begins Luffy's journey to master Haki and become strong enough for the New World.

keyMoments.title: Failed Attempt Against Giant Elephant
keyMoments.description: Luffy attempts to fight a giant elephant using Gear 2 but his attacks prove completely ineffective.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the gap between Luffy's current strength and what he needs to achieve to survive in the New World.

keyMoments.title: Placing the Straw Hat in Safety
keyMoments.description: Luffy places his precious straw hat and Rayleigh's Vivre Card in the only safe area on Rusukaina before beginning training.
keyMoments.significance: Symbolic moment showing Luffy's commitment to training by setting aside his pirate identity temporarily.
keyMoments.quote: I'll leave my hat here where it's safe.

keyMoments.title: Beginning Two-Year Training
keyMoments.description: Luffy officially begins his two-year training regimen with Rayleigh on Rusukaina to master Haki.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the official start of the timeskip period, one of the most significant transitions in the series.
keyMoments.quote: I'll get stronger! Strong enough to protect everyone!

reveals.information: Begins two-year training with Rayleigh to master Haki

name.japanese: シルバーズ・レイリー

keyMoments.title: Demonstrates Observation Haki
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh demonstrates Observation Haki by predicting the elephant's attacks with his eyes closed.
keyMoments.significance: First formal demonstration of Observation Haki to Luffy, teaching him one of the three fundamental Haki types.
keyMoments.quote: This is Observation Haki. It allows you to sense the presence of others and predict their movements.

keyMoments.title: Demonstrates Armament Haki
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh demonstrates Armament Haki by creating an invisible armor to block and counter the elephant's attack.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Armament Haki, essential for fighting Logia users and powerful enemies in the New World.
keyMoments.quote: This is Armament Haki. It creates an invisible armor to enhance your attack and defense.

keyMoments.title: Demonstrates Conqueror's Haki
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh demonstrates Conqueror's Haki by knocking out the giant elephant with his willpower alone.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the rarest and most powerful type of Haki, confirming Luffy possesses this ability.
keyMoments.quote: And this is Conqueror's Haki. Only one in several million people can use this power.

keyMoments.title: Explains the Three Types of Haki
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh provides a comprehensive explanation of all three types of Haki and their importance for surviving in the New World.
keyMoments.significance: First complete exposition of the Haki system, one of the most important power systems in One Piece.
keyMoments.quote: These are the three types of Haki. You must master them all if you want to survive in the New World.

keyMoments.title: Begins Training Luffy
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh officially begins his role as Luffy's mentor for a two-year training period on Rusukaina.
keyMoments.significance: Rayleigh takes on the responsibility of preparing the next generation's potential Pirate King.
keyMoments.quote: Conqueror's Haki cannot be controlled through training alone. You must grow as a person.

abilities.description: Rayleigh demonstrates advanced Observation Haki, sensing and predicting enemy movements with eyes closed.
Rayleigh demonstrates Armament Haki, creating invisible armor for enhanced offense and defense.
Rayleigh demonstrates Conqueror's Haki, knocking out the elephant with sheer willpower.

relationships.description: Rayleigh becomes Luffy's mentor, training him in Haki for two years.

evolutionMoments.description: Rayleigh takes Luffy to Rusukaina and begins teaching him about Haki.

reveals.information: Demonstrates mastery of all three types of Haki

keyMoments.title: Departs from Luffy
keyMoments.description: Jinbe says farewell to Luffy on the Kuja Pirates' ship and makes a promise to meet at Fish-Man Island in two years.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the end of Jinbe's role as Luffy's protector during the post-war period and sets up his future reunion with the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.quote: I'll see you at Fish-Man Island in two years!

relationships.description: Jinbe entrusts Luffy to Rayleigh and promises to meet him at Fish-Man Island.

evolutionMoments.description: Jinbe departs from Luffy with a promise to reunite in two years.

keyMoments.title: Transports Luffy to Rusukaina
keyMoments.description: Hancock brings Luffy and Rayleigh to Rusukaina island aboard her ship.
keyMoments.significance: Hancock facilitates Luffy's training by providing transportation to the remote island.

keyMoments.title: Offers to Bring Food Daily
keyMoments.description: Hancock enthusiastically offers to bring Luffy food every day but is told by Rayleigh that women are not allowed during training.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Hancock's devotion to Luffy and adds humor while establishing training boundaries.
keyMoments.quote: I'll bring you food every day from Amazon Lily!
